doc.title: TCOM 2Q25: The Goldilocks scenario for Trip.com?
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/TCOM 2Q25 The Goldilocks scenario for Trip.comTCOM 2Q25 The Goldilocks scenario for Trip.com_2025-08-29

passages.text: China Emerging Internet
**Small topline performance beat, but bottomline outperformance from S&M and**

**Product Development cost savings: 2Q25 Revenue came in at RMB14.8Bn +16.2%YoY,**beating estimates of +14.6%YoY. Gross margin was inline with estimates at 81%. Operating profit reached RMB4.1Bn and Net Profit reached RMB4.8Bn +25.5% beating consensus estimates of -4.2%. The company also announced a USD5Bn buyback program while completing its USD400Mn buyback for 2025.
**Resilient revenue growth driven by strong accommodation and Trip.com**

**performance: 2Q25 revenue grew** +16% driven by strong growth in accommodation, growing at +21%YoY and others growing at 31%. Accommodation performance was driven by resilient domestic revenue growth of 13%YoY while Outbound grew 17% and Trip.com growth reached >70%YoY. Transportation was also resilient, growing at 11%YoY, driven by 9% growth in Skyscanner and 45% growth in Trip.com air ticket revenues.
**Strong guide driven by international Trip.com business with margin expansion:**

The company guided for 3Q towards sustained revenue growth of +14.5%YoY, inline with consensus. This is driven by strength of Trip.com international business of +70%YoY for accommodation while domestic accommodation remained resilient at ~10%YoY with strong volume growth offset by pricing pressures. Non-GAAP OP to reach RMB5.8-5.9Bn at 32% margin in 3Q25.
**Competition and all that...what's happening under the hood?: The competition**

internationally has not abated and Agoda is ramping up price promotions across more countries. What we gather has happened is spending for APAC has gone up with more S&M spend directed here. At the same time, S&M spend domestically has been less intense driven by the weaker outbound issues and counter-intuitively the domestic competition has been weakened as Mietuan / BABA focus more on food delivery. **(Cont'd on next page)**
We rate PEOM Outperform TP USD78/HKD608. We raise our target price on higher EPS growth from better margin performance and value TCOM on 18x forward adj. EPS

So the profitability picture for Trip.com has deteriorated to \(> - 10\%\) operating profit, but the rest of the business is showing resilience and efficiency gains to fund this. We suspect AI initiatives across its cost base is contributing to this. (Cont'd on next page)

The Goldilocks scenario for TCOM: TCOM's stock has rallied on this print, and seems to us a combination of low expectations due to weak summer travel data and investors seem to welcome that TCOM has found a balance between its business lines to maintain a relatively strong domestic business but pivot spending to make the Trip.com international growth story still work and be profitable in 2028 in the face of the increased competition. If this scenario can continue its stock can grind higher as market prices in growth at a better cost. We take up our numbers and increase our TP slightly to reflect this better company efficiency. We caution that the risk of domestic competition has not yet disappeared - for now it seems JD.com has taken a back seat as it figures out how to get its travel product to work. In the long run the dent to TCOM's business will likely to be minimal and JD would take share more from other channels / partner rather than TCOM, but the threat of news causing a drop in stock price is still very much present.

3Q guidance points towards sustained revenue growth of \(12 - 17\% \text{YoY}\) with mid point at \(14 - 14.5\% \text{YoY}\) , inline with consensus. This is driven by strength of Trip.com international business while domestic accommodation, transportation and other businesses remain resilient. Non- GAAP OP to reach RMB5.8- 5.9Bn at \(32\%\) margin in 3Q25.

- On accommodation, 3Q to see resilient growth of \(14 - 19\% \text{YoY}\) with the mid point at RMB7.9Bn. Domestic accommodation to grow around high single digits to low teens as volume growth will be strong at mid teens offset by mid single digits pricing pressure. Outbound revenue to be at mid teens from market share gain from offline players. International Trip.com to experience sustained \(+70\% \text{YoY}\) growth in 3Q.- On transportation, 3Q to see similar growth levels of \(7 - 12\% \text{YoY}\) . Air and Rail will grow low single digit inline with industry while Outbound will experience single digit growth driven by mid teens volume growth but offset by high single digits pricing pressure. Trip.com air to grow at \(+50 - 60\% \text{YoY}\) , slower than hotels, on pricing and promotion discounts for flight tickets on the international market. Skyscanner to maintain at \(-9\% \text{YoY}\) growth.- Package tours to grow \(7 - 12\%\) from lower domestic grow rates driven by quality optimization while outbound will record high teens growth. Corporate to grow at \(7 - 12\%\) with midpoint at 700Mn and Others growing \(28 - 33\%\) with midpoint at RMB1.6Bn.- On Margins, GPM will remain steady at \(80 - 81\%\) . Marketing expenses to stay lower at \(22 - 23\%\) of revenue contributing to Non-GAAP OP profit to reach RMB5.8- 5.9Bn with \(32\%\) margin in 3Q25.
Source: Company reports, Bloomberg, Bernstein estimates and analysis

1. Ctrip net margin is assumed to be slightly higher than group overall's margin
2. Trip.com achieved breakeven on a contribution margin basis in 1Q24. We assumed it achieves a
higher margin from higher ASP in international business compared to domestic in 2028E when the
business becomes mature. We value this inline with average US OTA comps at 15x
3. Skyscanner net margin is assumed to be higher than Ctrip domestic group margin due to higher ASP
in international business. We value this inline with Expedia comps at 12x.
4. We apply a 50% discount on TCOM's major investments and 70% discount on their excess cash

(AB) completed a transaction that created a new joint venture in which their respective cash equities and research businesses operate in a new business combination. Although their respective ownership percentages in the joint venture differ between North America and the rest of the world, the creation, production and publication of research is handled collaboratively on a global basis across the two research brands, "Bernstein" and "Autonomous". Unless specifically noted otherwise, for purposes of these disclosures, references to Bernstein's "affiliates" relate to both SG and AB and their respective affiliates.

We value TCOM (PT of USD78.00/HKD608) using an average of DCF valuation and 18x NTM PE multiple on 2026E Adj EPS. We triangulate this with an SOTP valuation applying a 17x on Ctrip's 2026E EPS, 15x on Trip.com 2028E EPS, 12x on Skyscanner 2026E EPS and discounting major investments and cash by \(50\%\) and \(70\%\) respectively.

Downside risks: 1. China's macroeconomic conditions deteriorate further: Demand and appetite for travel could reduce further as macroeconomic conditions deteriorate further causing TCOM's domestic revenue to face headwinds. 2. Oversupply of travel capacity: Aggressive expansion in hotels and airlines could result in falling ASP on flights and accommodations causing total group revenue to fall more than expected. 3. Geopolitical policy driven risks of Trip.com's international expansion where governments could curtail the involvement of Chinese companies based on issues such as data security.

The Bernstein brand rates stocks based on forecasts of relative performance for the next 12 months versus the S&P 500 for stocks listed on the U.S. and Canadian exchanges, versus the Bloomberg Europe Developed Markets Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (EDM) for stocks listed on the European exchanges and emerging markets exchanges outside of the Asia Pacific region, versus the Bloomberg Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index USD (JP) for stocks listed on the Japanese exchanges, and versus the Bloomberg Asia ex- Japan Large and Mid Cap Price Return Index (ASIAX) for stocks listed on the Asian (ex- Japan) exchanges - unless otherwise specified.
The Bernstein brand has three categories of ratings:

- Outperform: Stock will outpace the market index by more than 15 pp- Market-Perform: Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-15 pp- Underperform: Stock will trail the performance of the market index by more than 15 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Not Covered (NC) denotes companies that are not under coverage.

The Autonomous brand rates stocks as indicated below. As our benchmarks we use the Bloomberg Europe 500 Banks And Financial Services Index (BEBANKS) and Bloomberg Europe Dev Mkt Financials Large and Mid Cap Price Ret Index EUR (EDMFI)index for developed European banks and Payments, the Bloomberg Europe 500 Insurance Index (BEINSUR) for European insurers, the S&P 500 and S&P Financials for US banks and Payments coverage, S5LIFE for US Insurance, the S&P Insurance Select Industry (SPSIINS) for US Non-Life Insurers coverage, and the Bloomberg Emerging Markets Financials Large, Mid and Small Cap Price Return Index (EMLSF) for emerging market banks and insurers and Payments. Ratings are stated relative to the sector (not the market).
The Autonomous brand has three categories of ratings:
·Outperform (OP): Stock will outpace the relevant index by more than 10 pp
·Neutral (N): Stock will perform in line with the market index to within +/-10 pp
·Underperform (UP): Stock will trail the performance of the relevant index by more than 10 pp

Coverage Suspended: Coverage of a company under the Bernstein research brand has been suspended. Ratings and price targets are suspended temporarily, are no longer current, and should therefore not be relied upon.

Not Rated: A rating assigned when the stock cannot be accurately valued, or the performance of the company accurately predicted, at the present time. The covering analyst may continue to publish research reports on the company to update investors on events and developments.
Those denoted as 'Feature' (e.g., Feature Outperform FOP, Feature Under Outperform FUP) are our core ideas. Not Covered (NC)denotes companies that are not under coverage.
For both brands, recommendations are based on a 12-month time horizon.
